title: Attention Graphic Designers
body: <p><strong title="STOP IT!">Please stop using IE for the Mac for your screenshots!</strong> I saw 3 different commercials today on TV that used it. Every time that you show your site in a Mac IE screenshot it tells me that you know absolutely nothing about web development. There are <em title="including but not limited to...">so many</em> other browsers that you could use:</p><ol><li>Internet Explorer 6.0+</li><li>Mozilla 1.0+</li><li><a title="Get Firefox!" href="http://www.spreadfirefox.com/?q=affiliates&amp;id=27747&amp;t=1">Firefox</a> 1.0+</li><li>Netscape 7.0+</li><li>Opera</li><li>Safari</li><li>Konqueror</li><li>Epiphany</li><li>Galeon</li><li>Camino</li><li>etc.</li></ol><p>I could go on for ages with acceptible browsers so here's the list of browsers NOT to use:</p><ol><li>Netscape 6 or lesser</li><li>Internet Explorer 5.5 or lesser for the PC</li><li>Any version of Internet Explorer for the Mac</li><li>Opera 7 or lesser</li></ol><p>Actually, this list could get long too. So here's a formula: take screenshots using only the newest, non-beta, version from the vendor's site. If you get a message that says that browser isn't supported, or there is any other kind of error regarding the vendor's site, then it's time to switch browsers.</p>
